text: you can see here there's a line of
police here they are effectively
protecting the Chinese relatives who
came here to try and speak to
journalists keeping the media away let's
just if we can get through excuse me
guys I'd like to go and speak to the
relatives behind on what why not excuse
me guys why are we not being allowed
through can you just tell me why are we
not being allowed through can you just
tell me you're live on BBC world anyone
here want to tell us why we can't speak
to the relatives anyone what did you say
sir no okay so you can you can see that
no one wants to explain it to us but we
can read between the lines the Chinese I
came here they've been kept in a
separate hotel from the journalists they
came here to try and speak to
journalists particularly Chinese
journalists they had a sign complaining
about the way they feel the
investigation is going and obviously
once word got round we were here there
was a pretty heavy-handed response
they've been taken away there's
obviously a lot of commotion because
there's so many journalists here in the
hotel but now they're being kept
somewhere back there one would imagine
they're trying to get them out of the
hotel somewhere else but certainly the
message of how frustrated they are about
how the investigations going we can
certainly we've certainly felt that
today by the screaming and kicking when
they were being taken away by the
Malaysians
